text: it began with a tremendous shaking
unlike anything in living memory
then came the water destroying
everything in its path and afterwards
the devastation whole towns washed off
the map this is the same place today
what used to be the city of
Rikuzentakata five years on the waka
soo-ji family is trying to find spot
their house used to stand when we first
met them five years ago
Sayaka and tacoma was still full of hope
their father would be found alive
this year's Sayaka wrote her first essay
on dealing his death I thought you up
let's steal I've seen out there I lost
my father in turn I'm late so many lies
for loss in our town each one is
important I think it is our duty as a
survivors to tell the world how dear
life is but it's clear from Tacoma there
is still a lot of suppressed trauma here
don't wanna see us if we talk about it I
feel down so I avoid talking about it so
you Hana Shiva I sometimes want to know
what my friends went through but I don't
ask because I'm worried that I may not
be able to help them I'm asking at this
America when the tsunami waves swept in
here nearly 2,000 people were killed in
this one small town that's nearly 10% of
the population the trauma has been
immense any governments first duty is to
protect its people and so it's perhaps
not surprising that this has been the
response
massive new walls like this one are
being built along 400 kilometers of
coastline the towns will be rebuilt on
higher ground away from the coast but
first new land must be created
it is a vast operation and it is slow
five years on Uemura is still waiting to
find out where her new house can be
built I sometimes think we'd be much
better off if we'd left here after the
tsunami and started a new life somewhere
else she says we've waited so long to
rebuild our lives in what used to be
their front garden Sayaka and tacoma
have found a little pine sapling they
decide to dig it up so they can plant it
at their new house a small sign of new
life in the midst of the devastation
rupert Wingfield Hayes BBC news in
Rikuzentakata Japan
